medical_history.chief_complaint: Bowed legs and 25(OH)D-deficient rickets at 20 months of age.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began at 20 months of age with bowed legs. He had difficulty in weight bearing, walking, and running. Previous attempts at treatment with large doses of parenteral vitamin D2 did not resolve his rickets or normalize his serum levels of 25(OH)D. At 24 months, he refused to walk, and by 29 months, he complained of leg pain when going up stairs. His symptoms included unsteady running, fatigue while walking, and inability to climb stairs consistently.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Born via cesarean section for facial presentation at 40 weeks gestation; no history of delayed tooth eruption, hypocalcemia, or seizures; adequate milk and cheese intake.
medical_history.family_history: Maternal grandmother, mother, and maternal aunt had previously been diagnosed with rickets, with the grandmother and mother presenting with symptoms at young ages. The maternal great-grandmother emigrated from Sweden and had a brother who died from similar leg issues.
